title: bug-repro: platform-aware reproduction with cross-platform verification
body:
## Summary

Redesign the bug-repro skill to dispatch to platform-specific playbooks instead of hard-coding console app patterns. Adds cross-platform verification to determine bug scope.

## Problem

The skill failed badly on WASM/Blazor issues (#3422, #3435):
- Zero mentions of Blazor, WASM, browser, or Playwright
- Phase 3 was 180 lines of hard-coded `dotnet new console` patterns
- Stopped at build success for WASM bugs (runtime errors only manifest in browser)
- AI concluded "SkiaSharp doesn't support .NET 10" — wrong (.NET is forward-compatible)

## Changes

### New platform files (`references/platform-*.md`)
| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| `platform-console.md` | Default: dotnet new console + dotnet run (extracted from SKILL.md) |
| `platform-wasm-blazor.md` | Blazor WASM + Playwright browser testing |
| `platform-docker-linux.md` | Linux in Docker (Debian/Alpine/arm64) |
| `platform-windows-desktop.md` | WPF/WinForms/WinUI stub |
| `platform-mobile.md` | iOS/Android/MAUI stub |

### SKILL.md restructure
- **Phase 2.4**: Platform dispatch table — selects platform file based on issue signals + triage data
- **Phase 2.5**: .NET forward-compatibility rule (net8.0 works on net10.0)
- **Phase 3A**: Delegates to platform file instead of inline code
- **Phase 3D** (NEW): Cross-platform verification — tests alternative platform to determine scope
- **Phase 4**: New `scope` field (`universal`/`platform-specific/{platform}`/`unknown`)
- **Anti-patterns #13-18**: TFM compat, build≠runtime, cross-platform verification rules

### Other files
- `repro-strategies.md` → `bug-categories.md` (renamed)
- `repro-schema.json`: `platform` field on versionResults, `scope` at root
- `repro-examples.md`: WASM example (#3422) showing cross-platform verification
- `conclusion-guide.md`: Scope derivation rules
- `triage-issue/SKILL.md`: .NET forward-compat anti-pattern
- `bug-pipeline.md`: Updated repro ownership

### Design decisions (Gemini + GPT Codex consensus)
- Cross-platform verification is **conditional** — skip for pure API/logic bugs
- Docker Linux x64 is the default alternative platform
- WASM only tested when issue signals suggest browser/web
- 5-minute time cap on Phase 3D
- `scope` field gives fix skill immediate scope signal

## Validation

Tested with `copilot -p`:
- **#2997** (console): reproduced ✅ — used platform-console.md, set `platform: host-macos-arm64`, `scope: unknown` (pure API bug)
- **#3422** (WASM): not-reproduced ✅ — used platform-wasm-blazor.md + Playwright, cross-platform verified with console app, corrected triage
